channel.title: Realtime Data Dumping
channel.description: Queestion: Would it be possible to dump alot of the "config" from thes erver while playing? Let me clarify. Lets say you edited a client so that everytime a new Npc is written to the visible region, the client writes the Npc ID and location to a file. So couldn't you just walk around RS, dumping all the locations, or approximate locations of all Npcs you encounter?

item.title: Realtime Data Dumping
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

I used to have a client which did exactly this except with mapdata?
I didn’t program it of course, and it’s probably nothing special and I’ll probably be laughed at for thinking it was of any use.

Whenever you would walk into a new area, it would simply dump that map into a dat file within the client folders somewhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Realtime Data Dumping

item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

this can be easily done but its highly detectable.

so jagex will ban the account it was done on?

Read full topic

item.title: Realtime Data Dumping
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

The Soul:

I’m not really understanding what you’re getting at, but if you could confirm this: you want to write NPCs and their locations to a file as you enter a region?

Ya, but not just Npc locations. Dialogues, Shop Items, everything that can be transferred in packets. For example shops. Whenever a player opens a shop in-game, the server sends the packet to open interface X. The server also sends the name of the shop, the items in the shop, and the amount of each item. So then the client would read that data, and create a ShopDefinition, that contained the name, the items, and the amounts.

Read full topic
